2773 /**
2774  * Encode a variable into JSON, with some sanity checks.
2775  *
2776  * @since 4.1.0
2777  *
2778  * @param mixed $data Variable (usually an array or object) to encode as JSON.
2779  * @param int $options Optional. Options to be passed to json_encode(). Default 0.
2780  * @param int $depth Optional. Maximum depth to walk through $data. Must be
2781  * greater than 0. Default 512.
2782  * @return string|false The JSON encoded string, or false if it cannot be encoded.
2783  */
2784 function wp_json_encode( $data, $options = 0, $depth = 512 ) {
2785  /*
2786  * json_encode() has had extra params added over the years.
2787  * $options was added in 5.3, and $depth in 5.5.
2788  * We need to make sure we call it with the correct arguments.
2789  */
2790  if ( version_compare( PHP_VERSION, '5.5', '>=' ) ) {
2791  $args = array( $data, $options, $depth );
2792  } elseif ( version_compare( PHP_VERSION, '5.3', '>=' ) ) {
2793  $args = array( $data, $options );
2794  } else {
2795  $args = array( $data );
2796  }
2797 
2798  // Prepare the data for JSON serialization.
2799  $data = _wp_json_prepare_data( $data );
2800 
2801  $json = @call_user_func_array( 'json_encode', $args );
2802 
2803  // If json_encode() was successful, no need to do more sanity checking.
2804  // ... unless we're in an old version of PHP, and json_encode() returned
2805  // a string containing 'null'. Then we need to do more sanity checking.
2806  if ( false !== $json && ( version_compare( PHP_VERSION, '5.5', '>=' ) || false === strpos( $json, 'null' ) ) ) {
2807  return $json;
2808  }
2809 
2810  try {
2811  $args[0] = _wp_json_sanity_check( $data, $depth );
2812  } catch ( Exception $e ) {
2813  return false;
2814  }
2815 
2816  return call_user_func_array( 'json_encode', $args );
2817 }
2818 
2819 /**
2820  * Perform sanity checks on data that shall be encoded to JSON.
2821  *
2822  * @ignore
2823  * @since 4.1.0
2824  * @access private
2825  *
2826  * @see wp_json_encode()
2827  *
2828  * @param mixed $data Variable (usually an array or object) to encode as JSON.
2829  * @param int $depth Maximum depth to walk through $data. Must be greater than 0.
2830  * @return mixed The sanitized data that shall be encoded to JSON.
2831  */
2832 function _wp_json_sanity_check( $data, $depth ) {
2833  if ( $depth < 0 ) {
2834  throw new Exception( 'Reached depth limit' );
2835  }
2836 
2837  if ( is_array( $data ) ) {
2838  $output = array();
2839  foreach ( $data as $id => $el ) {
2840  // Don't forget to sanitize the ID!
2841  if ( is_string( $id ) ) {
2842  $clean_id = _wp_json_convert_string( $id );
2843  } else {
2844  $clean_id = $id;
2845  }
2846 
2847  // Check the element type, so that we're only recursing if we really have to.
2848  if ( is_array( $el ) || is_object( $el ) ) {
2849  $output[ $clean_id ] = _wp_json_sanity_check( $el, $depth - 1 );
2850  } elseif ( is_string( $el ) ) {
2851  $output[ $clean_id ] = _wp_json_convert_string( $el );
2852  } else {
2853  $output[ $clean_id ] = $el;
2854  }
2855  }
2856  } elseif ( is_object( $data ) ) {
2857  $output = new stdClass;
2858  foreach ( $data as $id => $el ) {
2859  if ( is_string( $id ) ) {
2860  $clean_id = _wp_json_convert_string( $id );
2861  } else {
2862  $clean_id = $id;
2863  }
2864 
2865  if ( is_array( $el ) || is_object( $el ) ) {
2866  $output->$clean_id = _wp_json_sanity_check( $el, $depth - 1 );
2867  } elseif ( is_string( $el ) ) {
2868  $output->$clean_id = _wp_json_convert_string( $el );
2869  } else {
2870  $output->$clean_id = $el;
2871  }
2872  }
2873  } elseif ( is_string( $data ) ) {
2874  return _wp_json_convert_string( $data );
2875  } else {
2876  return $data;
2877  }
2878 
2879  return $output;
2880 }
2881 
2882 /**
2883  * Convert a string to UTF-8, so that it can be safely encoded to JSON.
2884  *
2885  * @ignore
2886  * @since 4.1.0
2887  * @access private
2888  *
2889  * @see _wp_json_sanity_check()
2890  *
2891  * @staticvar bool $use_mb
2892  *
2893  * @param string $string The string which is to be converted.
2894  * @return string The checked string.
2895  */
2896 function _wp_json_convert_string( $string ) {
2897  static $use_mb = null;
2898  if ( is_null( $use_mb ) ) {
2899  $use_mb = function_exists( 'mb_convert_encoding' );
2900  }
2901 
2902  if ( $use_mb ) {
2903  $encoding = mb_detect_encoding( $string, mb_detect_order(), true );
2904  if ( $encoding ) {
2905  return mb_convert_encoding( $string, 'UTF-8', $encoding );
2906  } else {
2907  return mb_convert_encoding( $string, 'UTF-8', 'UTF-8' );
2908  }
2909  } else {
2910  return wp_check_invalid_utf8( $string, true );
2911  }
2912 }
2913 
2914 /**
2915  * Prepares response data to be serialized to JSON.
2916  *
2917  * This supports the JsonSerializable interface for PHP 5.2-5.3 as well.
2918  *
2919  * @ignore
2920  * @since 4.4.0
2921  * @access private
2922  *
2923  * @param mixed $data Native representation.
2924  * @return bool|int|float|null|string|array Data ready for `json_encode()`.
2925  */
2926 function _wp_json_prepare_data( $data ) {
2927  if ( ! defined( 'WP_JSON_SERIALIZE_COMPATIBLE' ) || WP_JSON_SERIALIZE_COMPATIBLE === false ) {
2928  return $data;
2929  }
2930 
2931  switch ( gettype( $data ) ) {
2932  case 'boolean':
2933  case 'integer':
2934  case 'double':
2935  case 'string':
2936  case 'NULL':
2937  // These values can be passed through.
2938  return $data;
2939 
2940  case 'array':
2941  // Arrays must be mapped in case they also return objects.
2942  return array_map( '_wp_json_prepare_data', $data );
2943 
2944  case 'object':
2945  // If this is an incomplete object (__PHP_Incomplete_Class), bail.
2946  if ( ! is_object( $data ) ) {
2947  return null;
2948  }
2949 
2950  if ( $data instanceof JsonSerializable ) {
2951  $data = $data->jsonSerialize();
2952  } else {
2953  $data = get_object_vars( $data );
2954  }
2955 
2956  // Now, pass the array (or whatever was returned from jsonSerialize through).
2957  return _wp_json_prepare_data( $data );
2958 
2959  default:
2960  return null;
2961  }
2962 }

2964 /**
2965  * Send a JSON response back to an Ajax request.
2966  *
2967  * @since 3.5.0
2968  *
2969  * @param mixed $response Variable (usually an array or object) to encode as JSON,
2970  * then print and die.
2971  */
2972 function wp_send_json( $response ) {
2973  @header( 'Content-Type: application/json; charset=' . get_option( 'blog_charset' ) );
2974  echo wp_json_encode( $response );
2975  if ( defined( 'DOING_AJAX' ) && DOING_AJAX )
2976  wp_die();
2977  else
2978  die;
2979 }

2982  * Send a JSON response back to an Ajax request, indicating success.
2983  *
2984  * @since 3.5.0
2985  *
2986  * @param mixed $data Data to encode as JSON, then print and die.
2987  */
2988 function wp_send_json_success( $data = null ) {
2989  $response = array( 'success' => true );
2990

2992  $response['data'] = $data;
2993

2997 /**
2998  * Send a JSON response back to an Ajax request, indicating failure.
2999  *
3000  * If the `$data` parameter is a {@see WP_Error} object, the errors
3001  * within the object are processed and output as an array of error
3002  * codes and corresponding messages. All other types are output
3003  * without further processing.
3004  *
3005  * @since 3.5.0
3006  * @since 4.1.0 The `$data` parameter is now processed if a {@see WP_Error}

3226 /**
3227  * Merge user defined arguments into defaults array.
3228  *
3229  * This function is used throughout WordPress to allow for both string or array
3230  * to be merged into another array.
3231  *
3232  * @since 2.2.0
3233  *
3234  * @param string|array $args Value to merge with $defaults
3235  * @param array $defaults Optional. Array that serves as the defaults. Default empty.
3236  * @return array Merged user defined values with defaults.
3237  */
3238 function wp_parse_args( $args, $defaults = '' ) {
3239  if ( is_object( $args ) )
3240  $r = get_object_vars( $args );
3241  elseif ( is_array( $args ) )
3242  $r =& $args;
3243  else
3244  wp_parse_str( $args, $r );
3245 
3246  if ( is_array( $defaults ) )
3247  return array_merge( $defaults, $r );
3248  return $r;
3249 }

3302 /**
3303  * Filters a list of objects, based on a set of key => value arguments.
3304  *
3305  * @since 3.0.0
3306  *
3307  * @param array $list An array of objects to filter
3308  * @param array $args Optional. An array of key => value arguments to match
3309  * against each object. Default empty array.
3310  * @param string $operator Optional. The logical operation to perform. 'or' means
3311  * only one element from the array needs to match; 'and'
3312  * means all elements must match; 'not' means no elements may
3313  * match. Default 'and'.
3314  * @param bool|string $field A field from the object to place instead of the entire object.
3315  * Default false.
3316  * @return array A list of objects or object fields.
3317  */
3318 function wp_filter_object_list( $list, $args = array(), $operator = 'and', $field = false ) {
3319  if ( ! is_array( $list ) )
3320  return array();
3321 
3322  $list = wp_list_filter( $list, $args, $operator );
3323 
3324  if ( $field )
3325  $list = wp_list_pluck( $list, $field );
3326

3329 
3330 /**
3331  * Filters a list of objects, based on a set of key => value arguments.
3332  *
3333  * @since 3.1.0
3334  *
3335  * @param array $list An array of objects to filter.
3336  * @param array $args Optional. An array of key => value arguments to match
3337  * against each object. Default empty array.
3338  * @param string $operator Optional. The logical operation to perform. 'AND' means
3339  * all elements from the array must match. 'OR' means only
3340  * one element needs to match. 'NOT' means no elements may
3341  * match. Default 'AND'.
3342  * @return array Array of found values.
3343  */
3344 function wp_list_filter( $list, $args = array(), $operator = 'AND' ) {
3345  if ( ! is_array( $list ) )
3346  return array();
3347 
3348  if ( empty( $args ) )
3349  return $list;
3350 
3351  $operator = strtoupper( $operator );
3352  $count = count( $args );
3353  $filtered = array();
3354 
3355  foreach ( $list as $key => $obj ) {
3356  $to_match = (array) $obj;
3357 
3358  $matched = 0;
3359  foreach ( $args as $m_key => $m_value ) {
3360  if ( array_key_exists( $m_key, $to_match ) && $m_value == $to_match[ $m_key ] )
3361  $matched++;
3362  }
3363 
3364  if ( ( 'AND' == $operator && $matched == $count )
3365  || ( 'OR' == $operator && $matched > 0 )
3366  || ( 'NOT' == $operator && 0 == $matched ) ) {
3367  $filtered[$key] = $obj;
3368  }
3369  }
3370 
3371  return $filtered;
3372 }

3374 /**
3375  * Pluck a certain field out of each object in a list.
3376  *
3377  * This has the same functionality and prototype of
3378  * array_column() (PHP 5.5) but also supports objects.
3379  *
3380  * @since 3.1.0
3381  * @since 4.0.0 $index_key parameter added.
3382  *
3383  * @param array $list List of objects or arrays
3384  * @param int|string $field Field from the object to place instead of the entire object
3385  * @param int|string $index_key Optional. Field from the object to use as keys for the new array.
3386  * Default null.
3387  * @return array Array of found values. If `$index_key` is set, an array of found values with keys
3388  * corresponding to `$index_key`. If `$index_key` is null, array keys from the original
3389  * `$list` will be preserved in the results.
3390  */
3391 function wp_list_pluck( $list, $field, $index_key = null ) {
3392  if ( ! $index_key ) {
3393  /*
3394  * This is simple. Could at some point wrap array_column()
3395  * if we knew we had an array of arrays.
3396  */
3397  foreach ( $list as $key => $value ) {
3398  if ( is_object( $value ) ) {
3399  $list[ $key ] = $value->$field;
3400  } else {
3401  $list[ $key ] = $value[ $field ];
3402  }
3403  }
3404  return $list;
3405  }
3406 
3407  /*
3408  * When index_key is not set for a particular item, push the value
3409  * to the end of the stack. This is how array_column() behaves.
3410  */
3411  $newlist = array();
3412  foreach ( $list as $value ) {
3413  if ( is_object( $value ) ) {
3414  if ( isset( $value->$index_key ) ) {
3415  $newlist[ $value->$index_key ] = $value->$field;
3416  } else {
3417  $newlist[] = $value->$field;
3418  }
3419  } else {
3420  if ( isset( $value[ $index_key ] ) ) {
3421  $newlist[ $value[ $index_key ] ] = $value[ $field ];
3422  } else {
3423  $newlist[] = $value[ $field ];
3424  }
3425  }
3426  }
3427 
3428  return $newlist;
3429 }

3555 /**
3556  * Mark a function as deprecated and inform when it has been used.
3557  *
3558  * There is a hook deprecated_function_run that will be called that can be used
3559  * to get the backtrace up to what file and function called the deprecated
3560  * function.
3561  *
3562  * The current behavior is to trigger a user error if WP_DEBUG is true.
3563  *
3564  * This function is to be used in every function that is deprecated.
3565  *
3566  * @since 2.5.0
3567  * @access private
3568  *
3569  * @param string $function The function that was called.
3570  * @param string $version The version of WordPress that deprecated the function.
3571  * @param string $replacement Optional. The function that should have been called. Default null.
3572  */
3573 function _deprecated_function( $function, $version, $replacement = null ) {
3574 
3575  /**
3576  * Fires when a deprecated function is called.
3577  *
3578  * @since 2.5.0
3579  *
3580  * @param string $function The function that was called.
3581  * @param string $replacement The function that should have been called.
3582  * @param string $version The version of WordPress that deprecated the function.
3583  */
3584  do_action( 'deprecated_function_run', $function, $replacement, $version );
3585 
3586  /**
3587  * Filter whether to trigger an error for deprecated functions.
3588  *
3589  * @since 2.5.0
3590  *
3591  * @param bool $trigger Whether to trigger the error for deprecated functions. Default true.
3592  */
3593  if ( WP_DEBUG && apply_filters( 'deprecated_function_trigger_error', true ) ) {
3594  if ( function_exists( '__' ) ) {
3595  if ( ! is_null( $replacement ) )
3596  trigger_error( sprintf( __('%1$s is <strong>deprecated</strong> since version %2$s! Use %3$s instead.'), $function, $version, $replacement ) );
3597  else
3598  trigger_error( sprintf( __('%1$s is <strong>deprecated</strong> since version %2$s with no alternative available.'), $function, $version ) );
3599  } else {
3600  if ( ! is_null( $replacement ) )
3601  trigger_error( sprintf( '%1$s is <strong>deprecated</strong> since version %2$s! Use %3$s instead.', $function, $version, $replacement ) );
3602  else
3603  trigger_error( sprintf( '%1$s is <strong>deprecated</strong> since version %2$s with no alternative available.', $function, $version ) );
3604  }
3605  }
3606 }

3708  }

3839 /**
3840  * Does the specified module exist in the Apache config?
3841  *
3842  * @since 2.5.0
3843  *
3844  * @global bool $is_apache
3845  *
3846  * @param string $mod The module, e.g. mod_rewrite.
3847  * @param bool $default Optional. The default return value if the module is not found. Default false.
3848  * @return bool Whether the specified module is loaded.
3849  */
3850 function apache_mod_loaded($mod, $default = false) {
3851  global $is_apache;
3852 
3853  if ( !$is_apache )
3854  return false;
3855 
3856  if ( function_exists( 'apache_get_modules' ) ) {
3857  $mods = apache_get_modules();
3858  if ( in_array($mod, $mods) )
3859  return true;
3860  } elseif ( function_exists( 'phpinfo' ) && false === strpos( ini_get( 'disable_functions' ), 'phpinfo' ) ) {
3861  ob_start();
3862  phpinfo(8);
3863  $phpinfo = ob_get_clean();
3864  if ( false !== strpos($phpinfo, $mod) )
3865  return true;
3866  }
3867  return $default;
3868 }

3870 /**
3871  * Check if IIS 7+ supports pretty permalinks.
3872  *
3873  * @since 2.8.0
3874  *
3875  * @global bool $is_iis7
3876  *
3877  * @return bool Whether IIS7 supports permalinks.
3878  */
3879 function iis7_supports_permalinks() {
3880  global $is_iis7;
3881 
3882  $supports_permalinks = false;
3883  if ( $is_iis7 ) {
3884  /* First we check if the DOMDocument class exists. If it does not exist, then we cannot
3885  * easily update the xml configuration file, hence we just bail out and tell user that
3886  * pretty permalinks cannot be used.
3887  *
3888  * Next we check if the URL Rewrite Module 1.1 is loaded and enabled for the web site. When
3889  * URL Rewrite 1.1 is loaded it always sets a server variable called 'IIS_UrlRewriteModule'.
3890  * Lastly we make sure that PHP is running via FastCGI. This is important because if it runs
3891  * via ISAPI then pretty permalinks will not work.
3892  */
3893  $supports_permalinks = class_exists( 'DOMDocument', false ) && isset($_SERVER['IIS_UrlRewriteModule']) && ( PHP_SAPI == 'cgi-fcgi' );
3894  }
3895 
3896  /**
3897  * Filter whether IIS 7+ supports pretty permalinks.
3898  *
3899  * @since 2.8.0
3900  *
3901  * @param bool $supports_permalinks Whether IIS7 supports permalinks. Default false.
3902  */
3903  return apply_filters( 'iis7_supports_permalinks', $supports_permalinks );
3904 }

3906 /**
3907  * File validates against allowed set of defined rules.
3908  *
3909  * A return value of '1' means that the $file contains either '..' or './'. A
3910  * return value of '2' means that the $file contains ':' after the first
3911  * character. A return value of '3' means that the file is not in the allowed
3912  * files list.
3913  *
3914  * @since 1.2.0
3915  *
3916  * @param string $file File path.
3917  * @param array $allowed_files List of allowed files.
3918  * @return int 0 means nothing is wrong, greater than 0 means something was wrong.
3919  */
3920 function validate_file( $file, $allowed_files = '' ) {
3921  if ( false !== strpos( $file, '..' ) )
3922  return 1;
3923 
3924  if ( false !== strpos( $file, './' ) )
3925  return 1;
3926 
3927  if ( ! empty( $allowed_files ) && ! in_array( $file, $allowed_files ) )
3928  return 3;
3929 
3930  if (':' == substr( $file, 1, 1 ) )
3931  return 2;
3932 
3933  return 0;
3934 }

3936 /**
3937  * Determine if SSL is used.
3938  *
3939  * @since 2.6.0
3940  *
3941  * @return bool True if SSL, false if not used.
3942  */
3943 function is_ssl() {
3944  if ( isset($_SERVER['HTTPS']) ) {
3945  if ( 'on' == strtolower($_SERVER['HTTPS']) )
3946  return true;
3947  if ( '1' == $_SERVER['HTTPS'] )
3948  return true;
3949  } elseif ( isset($_SERVER['SERVER_PORT']) && ( '443' == $_SERVER['SERVER_PORT'] ) ) {
3950  return true;
3951  }
3952  return false;
3953 }

3977 /**
3978  * Guess the URL for the site.
3979  *
3980  * Will remove wp-admin links to retrieve only return URLs not in the wp-admin
3981  * directory.
3982  *
3983  * @since 2.6.0
3984  *
3985  * @return string The guessed URL.
3986  */
3987 function wp_guess_url() {
3988  if ( defined('WP_SITEURL') && '' != WP_SITEURL ) {
3989  $url = WP_SITEURL;
3990  } else {
3991  $abspath_fix = str_replace( '\\', '/', ABSPATH );
3992  $script_filename_dir = dirname( $_SERVER['SCRIPT_FILENAME'] );
3993 
3994  // The request is for the admin
3995  if ( strpos( $_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'], 'wp-admin' ) !== false || strpos( $_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'], 'wp-login.php' ) !== false ) {
3996  $path = preg_replace( '#/(wp-admin/.*|wp-login.php)#i', '', $_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'] );
3997 
3998  // The request is for a file in ABSPATH
3999  } elseif ( $script_filename_dir . '/' == $abspath_fix ) {
4000  // Strip off any file/query params in the path
4001  $path = preg_replace( '#/[^/]*$#i', '', $_SERVER['PHP_SELF'] );
4002 
4003  } else {
4004  if ( false !== strpos( $_SERVER['SCRIPT_FILENAME'], $abspath_fix ) ) {
4005  // Request is hitting a file inside ABSPATH
4006  $directory = str_replace( ABSPATH, '', $script_filename_dir );
4007  // Strip off the sub directory, and any file/query params
4008  $path = preg_replace( '#/' . preg_quote( $directory, '#' ) . '/[^/]*$#i', '' , $_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'] );
4009  } elseif ( false !== strpos( $abspath_fix, $script_filename_dir ) ) {
4010  // Request is hitting a file above ABSPATH
4011  $subdirectory = substr( $abspath_fix, strpos( $abspath_fix, $script_filename_dir ) + strlen( $script_filename_dir ) );
4012  // Strip off any file/query params from the path, appending the sub directory to the install
4013  $path = preg_replace( '#/[^/]*$#i', '' , $_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'] ) . $subdirectory;
4014  } else {
4015  $path = $_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'];
4016  }
4017  }
4018 
4019  $schema = is_ssl() ? 'https://' : 'http://'; // set_url_scheme() is not defined yet
4020  $url = $schema . $_SERVER['HTTP_HOST'] . $path;
4021  }
4022 
4023  return rtrim($url, '/');
4024 }

4028  *
4029  * Stops more data being added to the cache, but still allows cache retrieval.
4030  * This is useful for actions, such as imports, when a lot of data would otherwise
4031  * be almost uselessly added to the cache.

4033  * Suspension lasts for a single page load at most. Remember to call this

4043 function wp_suspend_cache_addition( $suspend = null ) {
4044  static $_suspend = false;
4045 
4046  if ( is_bool( $suspend ) )
4047  $_suspend = $suspend;
4048 
4049  return $_suspend;
4050 }

4074 /**

4099 /**
4100  * Determine whether a network is the main network of the Multisite install.
4101  *
4102  * @since 3.7.0
4103  *
4104  * @param int $network_id Optional. Network ID to test. Defaults to current network.
4105  * @return bool True if $network_id is the main network, or if not running Multisite.
4106  */
4107 function is_main_network( $network_id = null ) {
4108  if ( ! is_multisite() ) {
4109  return true;
4110  }

4112  $current_network_id = (int) get_current_site()->id;
4113 
4114  if ( null === $network_id ) {
4115  $network_id = $current_network_id;
4116  }
4117 
4118  $network_id = (int) $network_id;
4119 
4120  return ( $network_id === get_main_network_id() );
4121 }

4123 /**
4124  * Get the main network ID.
4125  *
4126  * @since 4.3.0
4127  *
4128  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
4129  *
4130  * @return int The ID of the main network.
4131  */
4132 function get_main_network_id() {
4133  global $wpdb;
4134 
4135  if ( ! is_multisite() ) {
4136  return 1;
4137  }
4138 
4139  if ( defined( 'PRIMARY_NETWORK_ID' ) ) {
4140  $main_network_id = PRIMARY_NETWORK_ID;
4141  } elseif ( 1 === (int) get_current_site()->id ) {
4142  // If the current network has an ID of 1, assume it is the main network.
4143  $main_network_id = 1;
4144  } else {
4145  $main_network_id = wp_cache_get( 'primary_network_id', 'site-options' );
4146 
4147  if ( false === $main_network_id ) {
4148  $main_network_id = (int) $wpdb->get_var( "SELECT id FROM {$wpdb->site} ORDER BY id LIMIT 1" );
4149  wp_cache_add( 'primary_network_id', $main_network_id, 'site-options' );
4150  }
4151  }

4157  *
4158  * @param int $main_network_id The ID of the main network.
4159  */
4160  return (int) apply_filters( 'get_main_network_id', $main_network_id );

4172 function global_terms_enabled() {

4206  */
4207 function wp_timezone_override_offset() {
4208  if ( !$timezone_string = get_option( 'timezone_string' ) ) {
4209  return false;
4210  }
4211 
4212  $timezone_object = timezone_open( $timezone_string );
4213  $datetime_object = date_create();
4214  if ( false === $timezone_object || false === $datetime_object ) {
4215  return false;
4216  }
4217  return round( timezone_offset_get( $timezone_object, $datetime_object ) / HOUR_IN_SECONDS, 2 );
4218 }

4220 /**
4221  * Sort-helper for timezones.
4222  *
4223  * @since 2.9.0
4224  * @access private
4225  *
4226  * @param array $a
4227  * @param array $b
4228  * @return int
4229  */
4230 function _wp_timezone_choice_usort_callback( $a, $b ) {
4231  // Don't use translated versions of Etc
4232  if ( 'Etc' === $a['continent'] && 'Etc' === $b['continent'] ) {
4233  // Make the order of these more like the old dropdown
4234  if ( 'GMT+' === substr( $a['city'], 0, 4 ) && 'GMT+' === substr( $b['city'], 0, 4 ) ) {
4235  return -1 * ( strnatcasecmp( $a['city'], $b['city'] ) );
4236  }
4237  if ( 'UTC' === $a['city'] ) {
4238  if ( 'GMT+' === substr( $b['city'], 0, 4 ) ) {
4239  return 1;
4240  }
4241  return -1;
4242  }
4243  if ( 'UTC' === $b['city'] ) {
4244  if ( 'GMT+' === substr( $a['city'], 0, 4 ) ) {
4245  return -1;
4246  }
4247  return 1;
4248  }
4249  return strnatcasecmp( $a['city'], $b['city'] );
4250  }
4251  if ( $a['t_continent'] == $b['t_continent'] ) {
4252  if ( $a['t_city'] == $b['t_city'] ) {
4253  return strnatcasecmp( $a['t_subcity'], $b['t_subcity'] );
4254  }
4255  return strnatcasecmp( $a['t_city'], $b['t_city'] );
4256  } else {
4257  // Force Etc to the bottom of the list
4258  if ( 'Etc' === $a['continent'] ) {
4259  return 1;
4260  }
4261  if ( 'Etc' === $b['continent'] ) {
4262  return -1;
4263  }
4264  return strnatcasecmp( $a['t_continent'], $b['t_continent'] );
4265  }
4266 }

4268 /**
4269  * Gives a nicely-formatted list of timezone strings.
4270  *
4271  * @since 2.9.0
4272  *
4273  * @staticvar bool $mo_loaded
4274  *
4275  * @param string $selected_zone Selected timezone.
4276  * @return string
4277  */
4278 function wp_timezone_choice( $selected_zone ) {
4279  static $mo_loaded = false;
4280 
4281  $continents = array( 'Africa', 'America', 'Antarctica', 'Arctic', 'Asia', 'Atlantic', 'Australia', 'Europe', 'Indian', 'Pacific');
4282 
4283  // Load translations for continents and cities
4284  if ( !$mo_loaded ) {
4285  $locale = get_locale();
4286  $mofile = WP_LANG_DIR . '/continents-cities-' . $locale . '.mo';
4287  load_textdomain( 'continents-cities', $mofile );
4288  $mo_loaded = true;
4289  }
4290 
4291  $zonen = array();
4292  foreach ( timezone_identifiers_list() as $zone ) {
4293  $zone = explode( '/', $zone );
4294  if ( !in_array( $zone[0], $continents ) ) {
4295  continue;
4296  }
4297 
4298  // This determines what gets set and translated - we don't translate Etc/* strings here, they are done later
4299  $exists = array(
4300  0 => ( isset( $zone[0] ) && $zone[0] ),
4301  1 => ( isset( $zone[1] ) && $zone[1] ),
4302  2 => ( isset( $zone[2] ) && $zone[2] ),
4303  );
4304  $exists[3] = ( $exists[0] && 'Etc' !== $zone[0] );
4305  $exists[4] = ( $exists[1] && $exists[3] );
4306  $exists[5] = ( $exists[2] && $exists[3] );
4307 
4308  $zonen[] = array(
4309  'continent' => ( $exists[0] ? $zone[0] : '' ),
4310  'city' => ( $exists[1] ? $zone[1] : '' ),
4311  'subcity' => ( $exists[2] ? $zone[2] : '' ),
4312  't_continent' => ( $exists[3] ? translate( str_replace( '_', ' ', $zone[0] ), 'continents-cities' ) : '' ),
4313  't_city' => ( $exists[4] ? translate( str_replace( '_', ' ', $zone[1] ), 'continents-cities' ) : '' ),
4314  't_subcity' => ( $exists[5] ? translate( str_replace( '_', ' ', $zone[2] ), 'continents-cities' ) : '' )
4315  );
4316  }
4317  usort( $zonen, '_wp_timezone_choice_usort_callback' );
4318 
4319  $structure = array();
4320 
4321  if ( empty( $selected_zone ) ) {
4322  $structure[] = '<option selected="selected" value="">' . __( 'Select a city' ) . '</option>';
4323  }
4324 
4325  foreach ( $zonen as $key => $zone ) {
4326  // Build value in an array to join later
4327  $value = array( $zone['continent'] );
4328 
4329  if ( empty( $zone['city'] ) ) {
4330  // It's at the continent level (generally won't happen)
4331  $display = $zone['t_continent'];
4332  } else {
4333  // It's inside a continent group
4334 
4335  // Continent optgroup
4336  if ( !isset( $zonen[$key - 1] ) || $zonen[$key - 1]['continent'] !== $zone['continent'] ) {
4337  $label = $zone['t_continent'];
4338  $structure[] = '<optgroup label="'. esc_attr( $label ) .'">';
4339  }
4340 
4341  // Add the city to the value
4342  $value[] = $zone['city'];
4343 
4344  $display = $zone['t_city'];
4345  if ( !empty( $zone['subcity'] ) ) {
4346  // Add the subcity to the value
4347  $value[] = $zone['subcity'];
4348  $display .= ' - ' . $zone['t_subcity'];
4349  }
4350  }
4351 
4352  // Build the value
4353  $value = join( '/', $value );
4354  $selected = '';
4355  if ( $value === $selected_zone ) {
4356  $selected = 'selected="selected" ';
4357  }
4358  $structure[] = '<option ' . $selected . 'value="' . esc_attr( $value ) . '">' . esc_html( $display ) . "</option>";
4359 
4360  // Close continent optgroup
4361  if ( !empty( $zone['city'] ) && ( !isset($zonen[$key + 1]) || (isset( $zonen[$key + 1] ) && $zonen[$key + 1]['continent'] !== $zone['continent']) ) ) {
4362  $structure[] = '</optgroup>';
4363  }
4364  }
4365 
4366  // Do UTC
4367  $structure[] = '<optgroup label="'. esc_attr__( 'UTC' ) .'">';
4368  $selected = '';
4369  if ( 'UTC' === $selected_zone )
4370  $selected = 'selected="selected" ';
4371  $structure[] = '<option ' . $selected . 'value="' . esc_attr( 'UTC' ) . '">' . __('UTC') . '</option>';
4372  $structure[] = '</optgroup>';
4373 
4374  // Do manual UTC offsets
4375  $structure[] = '<optgroup label="'. esc_attr__( 'Manual Offsets' ) .'">';
4376  $offset_range = array (-12, -11.5, -11, -10.5, -10, -9.5, -9, -8.5, -8, -7.5, -7, -6.5, -6, -5.5, -5, -4.5, -4, -3.5, -3, -2.5, -2, -1.5, -1, -0.5,
4377  0, 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3, 3.5, 4, 4.5, 5, 5.5, 5.75, 6, 6.5, 7, 7.5, 8, 8.5, 8.75, 9, 9.5, 10, 10.5, 11, 11.5, 12, 12.75, 13, 13.75, 14);
4378  foreach ( $offset_range as $offset ) {
4379  if ( 0 <= $offset )
4380  $offset_name = '+' . $offset;
4381  else
4382  $offset_name = (string) $offset;
4383 
4384  $offset_value = $offset_name;
4385  $offset_name = str_replace(array('.25','.5','.75'), array(':15',':30',':45'), $offset_name);
4386  $offset_name = 'UTC' . $offset_name;
4387  $offset_value = 'UTC' . $offset_value;
4388  $selected = '';
4389  if ( $offset_value === $selected_zone )
4390  $selected = 'selected="selected" ';
4391  $structure[] = '<option ' . $selected . 'value="' . esc_attr( $offset_value ) . '">' . esc_html( $offset_name ) . "</option>";
4392 
4393  }
4394  $structure[] = '</optgroup>';
4395 
4396  return join( "\n", $structure );
4397 }

4399 /**
4400  * Strip close comment and close php tags from file headers used by WP.
4401  *
4402  * @since 2.8.0
4403  * @access private
4404  *
4405  * @see https://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/8497

4410 function _cleanup_header_comment( $str ) {

4414 /**
4415  * Permanently delete comments or posts of any type that have held a status
4416  * of 'trash' for the number of days defined in EMPTY_TRASH_DAYS.
4417  *
4418  * The default value of `EMPTY_TRASH_DAYS` is 30 (days).
4419  *
4420  * @since 2.9.0
4421  *
4422  * @global wpdb $wpdb WordPress database abstraction object.
4423  */
4424 function wp_scheduled_delete() {
4425  global $wpdb;
4426 
4427  $delete_timestamp = time() - ( DAY_IN_SECONDS * EMPTY_TRASH_DAYS );
4428 
4429  $posts_to_delete = $wpdb->get_results($wpdb->prepare("SELECT post_id FROM $wpdb->postmeta WHERE meta_key = '_wp_trash_meta_time' AND meta_value < '%d'", $delete_timestamp), ARRAY_A);
4430 
4431  foreach ( (array) $posts_to_delete as $post ) {
4432  $post_id = (int) $post['post_id'];
4433  if ( !$post_id )
4434  continue;
4435 
4436  $del_post = get_post($post_id);
4437 
4438  if ( !$del_post || 'trash' != $del_post->post_status ) {
4439  delete_post_meta($post_id, '_wp_trash_meta_status');
4440  delete_post_meta($post_id, '_wp_trash_meta_time');
4441  } else {
4442  wp_delete_post($post_id);
4443  }
4444  }
4445 
4446  $comments_to_delete = $wpdb->get_results($wpdb->prepare("SELECT comment_id FROM $wpdb->commentmeta WHERE meta_key = '_wp_trash_meta_time' AND meta_value < '%d'", $delete_timestamp), ARRAY_A);
4447 
4448  foreach ( (array) $comments_to_delete as $comment ) {
4449  $comment_id = (int) $comment['comment_id'];
4450  if ( !$comment_id )
4451  continue;
4452 
4453  $del_comment = get_comment($comment_id);
4454 
4455  if ( !$del_comment || 'trash' != $del_comment->comment_approved ) {
4456  delete_comment_meta($comment_id, '_wp_trash_meta_time');
4457  delete_comment_meta($comment_id, '_wp_trash_meta_status');
4458  } else {
4459  wp_delete_comment( $del_comment );
4460  }
4461  }
4462 }

4464 /**
4465  * Retrieve metadata from a file.
4466  *
4467  * Searches for metadata in the first 8kiB of a file, such as a plugin or theme.
4468  * Each piece of metadata must be on its own line. Fields can not span multiple
4469  * lines, the value will get cut at the end of the first line.
4470  *
4471  * If the file data is not within that first 8kiB, then the author should correct
4472  * their plugin file and move the data headers to the top.
4473  *
4474  * @link https://codex.wordpress.org/File_Header
4475  *
4476  * @since 2.9.0
4477  *
4478  * @param string $file Path to the file.
4479  * @param array $default_headers List of headers, in the format array('HeaderKey' => 'Header Name').
4480  * @param string $context Optional. If specified adds filter hook "extra_{$context}_headers".
4481  * Default empty.
4482  * @return array Array of file headers in `HeaderKey => Header Value` format.
4483  */
4484 function get_file_data( $file, $default_headers, $context = '' ) {
4485  // We don't need to write to the file, so just open for reading.
4486  $fp = fopen( $file, 'r' );
4487 
4488  // Pull only the first 8kiB of the file in.
4489  $file_data = fread( $fp, 8192 );
4490 
4491  // PHP will close file handle, but we are good citizens.
4492  fclose( $fp );
4493 
4494  // Make sure we catch CR-only line endings.
4495  $file_data = str_replace( "\r", "\n", $file_data );
4496 
4497  /**
4498  * Filter extra file headers by context.
4499  *
4500  * The dynamic portion of the hook name, `$context`, refers to
4501  * the context where extra headers might be loaded.
4502  *
4503  * @since 2.9.0
4504  *
4505  * @param array $extra_context_headers Empty array by default.
4506  */
4507  if ( $context && $extra_headers = apply_filters( "extra_{$context}_headers", array() ) ) {
4508  $extra_headers = array_combine( $extra_headers, $extra_headers ); // keys equal values
4509  $all_headers = array_merge( $extra_headers, (array) $default_headers );
4510  } else {
4511  $all_headers = $default_headers;
4512  }
4513 
4514  foreach ( $all_headers as $field => $regex ) {
4515  if ( preg_match( '/^[ \t\/*#@]*' . preg_quote( $regex, '/' ) . ':(.*)$/mi', $file_data, $match ) && $match[1] )
4516  $all_headers[ $field ] = _cleanup_header_comment( $match[1] );
4517  else
4518  $all_headers[ $field ] = '';
4519  }
4520 
4521  return $all_headers;
4522 }

4645 /**
4646  * Find hierarchy loops using a callback function that maps object IDs to parent IDs.
4647  *
4648  * @since 3.1.0
4649  * @access private
4650  *
4651  * @param callable $callback Function that accepts ( ID, $callback_args ) and outputs parent_ID.
4652  * @param int $start The ID to start the loop check at.
4653  * @param int $start_parent The parent_ID of $start to use instead of calling $callback( $start ).
4654  * Use null to always use $callback
4655  * @param array $callback_args Optional. Additional arguments to send to $callback.
4656  * @return array IDs of all members of loop.
4657  */
4658 function wp_find_hierarchy_loop( $callback, $start, $start_parent, $callback_args = array() ) {
4659  $override = is_null( $start_parent ) ? array() : array( $start => $start_parent );
4660 
4661  if ( !$arbitrary_loop_member = wp_find_hierarchy_loop_tortoise_hare( $callback, $start, $override, $callback_args ) )
4662  return array();
4663 
4664  return wp_find_hierarchy_loop_tortoise_hare( $callback, $arbitrary_loop_member, $override, $callback_args, true );
4665 }
4666 
4667 /**
4668  * Use the "The Tortoise and the Hare" algorithm to detect loops.
4669  *
4670  * For every step of the algorithm, the hare takes two steps and the tortoise one.
4671  * If the hare ever laps the tortoise, there must be a loop.
4672  *
4673  * @since 3.1.0
4674  * @access private
4675  *
4676  * @param callable $callback Function that accepts ( ID, callback_arg, ... ) and outputs parent_ID.
4677  * @param int $start The ID to start the loop check at.
4678  * @param array $override Optional. An array of ( ID => parent_ID, ... ) to use instead of $callback.
4679  * Default empty array.
4680  * @param array $callback_args Optional. Additional arguments to send to $callback. Default empty array.
4681  * @param bool $_return_loop Optional. Return loop members or just detect presence of loop? Only set
4682  * to true if you already know the given $start is part of a loop (otherwise
4683  * the returned array might include branches). Default false.
4684  * @return mixed Scalar ID of some arbitrary member of the loop, or array of IDs of all members of loop if
4685  * $_return_loop
4686  */
4687 function wp_find_hierarchy_loop_tortoise_hare( $callback, $start, $override = array(), $callback_args = array(), $_return_loop = false ) {
4688  $tortoise = $hare = $evanescent_hare = $start;
4689  $return = array();
4690 
4691  // Set evanescent_hare to one past hare
4692  // Increment hare two steps
4693  while (
4694  $tortoise
4695  &&
4696  ( $evanescent_hare = isset( $override[$hare] ) ? $override[$hare] : call_user_func_array( $callback, array_merge( array( $hare ), $callback_args ) ) )
4697  &&
4698  ( $hare = isset( $override[$evanescent_hare] ) ? $override[$evanescent_hare] : call_user_func_array( $callback, array_merge( array( $evanescent_hare ), $callback_args ) ) )
4699  ) {
4700  if ( $_return_loop )
4701  $return[$tortoise] = $return[$evanescent_hare] = $return[$hare] = true;
4702 
4703  // tortoise got lapped - must be a loop
4704  if ( $tortoise == $evanescent_hare || $tortoise == $hare )
4705  return $_return_loop ? $return : $tortoise;
4706 
4707  // Increment tortoise by one step
4708  $tortoise = isset( $override[$tortoise] ) ? $override[$tortoise] : call_user_func_array( $callback, array_merge( array( $tortoise ), $callback_args ) );
4709  }
4710 
4711  return false;
4712 }

4759 /**
4760  * Return a comma-separated string of functions that have been called to get
4761  * to the current point in code.
4762  *
4763  * @since 3.4.0
4764  *
4765  * @see https://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/19589
4766  *
4767  * @param string $ignore_class Optional. A class to ignore all function calls within - useful
4768  * when you want to just give info about the callee. Default null.
4769  * @param int $skip_frames Optional. A number of stack frames to skip - useful for unwinding
4770  * back to the source of the issue. Default 0.
4771  * @param bool $pretty Optional. Whether or not you want a comma separated string or raw
4772  * array returned. Default true.
4773  * @return string|array Either a string containing a reversed comma separated trace or an array
4774  * of individual calls.
4775  */
4776 function wp_debug_backtrace_summary( $ignore_class = null, $skip_frames = 0, $pretty = true ) {
4777  if ( version_compare( PHP_VERSION, '5.2.5', '>=' ) )
4778  $trace = debug_backtrace( false );
4779  else
4780  $trace = debug_backtrace();
4781 
4782  $caller = array();
4783  $check_class = ! is_null( $ignore_class );
4784  $skip_frames++; // skip this function
4785 
4786  foreach ( $trace as $call ) {
4787  if ( $skip_frames > 0 ) {
4788  $skip_frames--;
4789  } elseif ( isset( $call['class'] ) ) {
4790  if ( $check_class && $ignore_class == $call['class'] )
4791  continue; // Filter out calls
4792 
4793  $caller[] = "{$call['class']}{$call['type']}{$call['function']}";
4794  } else {
4795  if ( in_array( $call['function'], array( 'do_action', 'apply_filters' ) ) ) {
4796  $caller[] = "{$call['function']}('{$call['args'][0]}')";
4797  } elseif ( in_array( $call['function'], array( 'include', 'include_once', 'require', 'require_once' ) ) ) {
4798  $caller[] = $call['function'] . "('" . str_replace( array( WP_CONTENT_DIR, ABSPATH ) , '', $call['args'][0] ) . "')";
4799  } else {
4800  $caller[] = $call['function'];
4801  }
4802  }
4803  }
4804  if ( $pretty )
4805  return join( ', ', array_reverse( $caller ) );
4806  else
4807  return $caller;
4808 }

4998 /**
4999  * Return RegEx body to liberally match an opening HTML tag.
5000  *
5001  * Matches an opening HTML tag that:
5002  * 1. Is self-closing or
5003  * 2. Has no body but has a closing tag of the same name or
5004  * 3. Contains a body and a closing tag of the same name
5005  *
5006  * Note: this RegEx does not balance inner tags and does not attempt
5007  * to produce valid HTML
5008  *
5009  * @since 3.6.0
5010  *
5011  * @param string $tag An HTML tag name. Example: 'video'.
5012  * @return string Tag RegEx.
5013  */
5014 function get_tag_regex( $tag ) {
5015  if ( empty( $tag ) )
5016  return;
5017  return sprintf( '<%1$s[^<]*(?:>[\s\S]*<\/%1$s>|\s*\/>)', tag_escape( $tag ) );
5018 }

5020 /**
5021  * Retrieve a canonical form of the provided charset appropriate for passing to PHP
5022  * functions such as htmlspecialchars() and charset html attributes.
5023  *
5024  * @since 3.6.0
5025  * @access private
5026  *
5027  * @see https://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/23688
5028  *
5029  * @param string $charset A charset name.
5030  * @return string The canonical form of the charset.
5031  */
5032 function _canonical_charset( $charset ) {
5033  if ( 'UTF-8' === $charset || 'utf-8' === $charset || 'utf8' === $charset ||
5034  'UTF8' === $charset )
5035  return 'UTF-8';
5036 
5037  if ( 'ISO-8859-1' === $charset || 'iso-8859-1' === $charset ||
5038  'iso8859-1' === $charset || 'ISO8859-1' === $charset )
5039  return 'ISO-8859-1';
5040 
5041  return $charset;

5044 /**
5045  * Set the mbstring internal encoding to a binary safe encoding when func_overload
5046  * is enabled.
5047  *
5048  * When mbstring.func_overload is in use for multi-byte encodings, the results from
5049  * strlen() and similar functions respect the utf8 characters, causing binary data
5050  * to return incorrect lengths.
5051  *
5052  * This function overrides the mbstring encoding to a binary-safe encoding, and
5053  * resets it to the users expected encoding afterwards through the
5054  * `reset_mbstring_encoding` function.
5055  *
5056  * It is safe to recursively call this function, however each
5057  * `mbstring_binary_safe_encoding()` call must be followed up with an equal number
5058  * of `reset_mbstring_encoding()` calls.
5059  *
5060  * @since 3.7.0
5061  *
5062  * @see reset_mbstring_encoding()
5063  *
5064  * @staticvar array $encodings
5065  * @staticvar bool $overloaded
5066  *
5067  * @param bool $reset Optional. Whether to reset the encoding back to a previously-set encoding.
5068  * Default false.
5069  */
5070 function mbstring_binary_safe_encoding( $reset = false ) {
5071  static $encodings = array();
5072  static $overloaded = null;
5073 
5074  if ( is_null( $overloaded ) )
5075  $overloaded = function_exists( 'mb_internal_encoding' ) && ( ini_get( 'mbstring.func_overload' ) & 2 );
5076 
5077  if ( false === $overloaded )
5078  return;
5079 
5080  if ( ! $reset ) {
5081  $encoding = mb_internal_encoding();
5082  array_push( $encodings, $encoding );
5083  mb_internal_encoding( 'ISO-8859-1' );
5084  }
5085 
5086  if ( $reset && $encodings ) {
5087  $encoding = array_pop( $encodings );
5088  mb_internal_encoding( $encoding );
5089  }
5090 }
5091 
5092 /**
5093  * Reset the mbstring internal encoding to a users previously set encoding.
5094  *
5095  * @see mbstring_binary_safe_encoding()
5096  *
5097  * @since 3.7.0
5098  */
5099 function reset_mbstring_encoding() {
5100  mbstring_binary_safe_encoding( true );
5101 }

5104  * Filter/validate a variable as a boolean.
5105  *
5106  * Alternative to `filter_var( $var, FILTER_VALIDATE_BOOLEAN )`.
5107  *
5108  * @since 4.0.0
5109  *
5110  * @param mixed $var Boolean value to validate.
5111  * @return bool Whether the value is validated.
5112  */

5114  if ( is_bool( $var ) ) {
5115  return $var;
5116  }
5117 
5118  if ( is_string( $var ) && 'false' === strtolower( $var ) ) {
5119  return false;
5120  }
5121 
5122  return (bool) $var;
5123 }

5180 /**

5182  *
5183  * Explicitly strips timezones, as datetimes are not saved with any timezone
5184  * information. Including any information on the offset could be misleading.

5195  return preg_replace( '/(?:Z|[+-]\d{2}(?::\d{2})?)$/', '', $formatted );
5196 }
